Name: Federal Government Lesson for Kids
Subject: ['government', 'executive branch', 'education', 'law, govt and politics', 'special education']
Description: The federal government in Washington, D.C., is made up of three branches. In this lesson, you will learn how the people who created the United States decided it was a good idea that each branch keep an eye on each other.
Concepts: ['United States', 'U.S. state', 'President of the United States', 'Federal government', 'Federal government of the United States', 'United States Constitution', 'Washington, D.C.', 'Puerto Rico']
